Detailed Description

The PyramidSwarm implements the hierarchical version of Swarm.

The birds are arranged pyramid-like, with the globalbest bird on top. After the evaluation of the current position birds within a N(x) neighbourhood are compared and the best one moves towards the top one level.
Irregular structures (height, branches) are built by distributing the remaining nodes at the bottom level of the pyramid

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PyramidSwarm::PyramidSwarm ( PSO *  pso_p,
int  size,
int  dim,
double  min_x,
double  max_x,
double  min_v,
double  max_v,
int  height,
int  branches,
int  swapDelay,
int  nrScouts_in = 0 
)

Constructor for H-PSO, setting up the swarm and arranging it in a pyramid shape.

Parameters:
pso_p  The PSO Algorithm for the parameters used
size  The number of birds to create
dim  The dimension of the search space, i.e. the function to be optimized
min_x  Lower bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
max_x  Upper bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
min_v  Lower bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
max_v  Upper bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
height  The height (levels) of the pyramid
branches  How many successors there are on the level below
swapDelay  A swap is only allowed every swapDelay steps
nrScouts_in  The number of additional scouts, default = 0

Reimplemented from Swarm.

int PyramidSwarm::step ( int  steps = 1  )  [virtual]

The pyramidswarm does steps steps.

Within one iteration the following actions are done for all the birds.
The current position is evaluated, within each neighbourhood the iteration best bird is determined and compared to the bird above, the arrangment is adjusted - the best bird per neighbourhood moves up one level, the current velocity is adjusted to the global best bird and the birds are moved.

Reimplemented from Swarm.

Reimplemented in DynamicPyramidSwarm, and AdaptivePyramidSwarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void PyramidSwarm::hierarchicalCompare (  )  [protected]

According to the pyramid hierarchy the birds are compared and swapped.

Each bird is compared to its direct children and is swapped with the best sibling, if this one is better than the upper level node.

reset the reEvaluated state (used for noisy functions)

Here is the call graph for this function:

void PyramidSwarm::updateVel (  )  [protected, virtual]

The velocities of the birds are updated.

The children of each node update their velocity with their parent node as global best.

Reimplemented from Swarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void PyramidSwarm::updateBirdContainerLevels (  )  [protected]

The levels of the BirdContainers in birdContainerLevels is updated.

Also for each bird the subswarm -- branch below the root -- and the subtree -- hierarchy divided in half, which section of the hierarchy. The root subtree is index 0, and the other subtrees start at division depth. used for DynamicPyramidSwarm

Here is the call graph for this function:

void PyramidSwarm::calculateDiversitySubtree (  )  [protected]

Calculate the diversity for the individual subtrees.

The average and median distance to the subtree's mean position are calculated

void PyramidSwarm::updateMeanPositionSubtree ( int  subtreeNr,
set< int >  randomSet 
) [protected]

Determine the current mean position of the subtree or the given randomSet.

All the birds of the subtree current positions are averaged. For a random set of birds subtreeNr = -1 is passed

Member Data Documentation

int PyramidSwarm::currentHeight [protected]

The height of the pyramid.

May differ from height for irregular pyramids, where an extra level is added for the extra nodes. Or for an AdaptivePyramidSwarm, where the hierarchy is changed.

bool PyramidSwarm::swapEnabled [protected]

Controls whether in the current step a swap is allowed.

int PyramidSwarm::swapDelay [protected]

A swap is only allowed every swapDelay steps.

int PyramidSwarm::branches [protected]

The number of children per node.

int PyramidSwarm::height [protected]

The number of levels of the pyramid.

The possible extra level for irregular pyramids excluded

bool PyramidSwarm::regularPyramid [protected]

Whether the pyramid shape is regular.

tree<BirdContainer> PyramidSwarm::pyramid [protected]

The main data structure for PyramidSwarm operations.

The bird pointers are still stored in the birds vector. In the pyramid data structure the container objects with pointers to the birds are moved.

map<int, int> PyramidSwarm::birdContainerLevels [protected]

The levels of the different BirdContainers in the pyramid.

The map is accessed by the index of a specific bird.

map<int, int> PyramidSwarm::birdContainerSubtree [protected]

The subtree of the different BirdContainers in the pyramid.

map<int, int> PyramidSwarm::birdContainerSubswarm [protected]

The subswarms of the different BirdContainers in the pyramid.

The map is accessed by the index of a specific bird.used in DynamicPyramidSwarm
The map is accessed by the index of a specific bird.

vector<double> PyramidSwarm::meanPositionSubtree [protected]

The current mean position of the swarm of a single subtree.

The subtrees are iterated and before each evaluation PyramidSwarm::updateMeanPositionSubtree is called.

double* PyramidSwarm::averageDiversitySubtree [protected]

Array of the current average distance to the mean position per subtree.

double* PyramidSwarm::medianDiversitySubtree [protected]

Array of the current median distance to the mean position per subtree.

deque<int> PyramidSwarm::extraNodesList [protected]

If the pyramid to be built is not regular (heights, branches != swarmsize).

The number of extra nodes to be added to the lowest level is given. The list of numbers is computed in PyramidSwarm::PyramidSwarm

vector<int> PyramidSwarm::gbestFromSubtreeTick [protected]

The last time tick, gbest came from subtree i.

The vector is initialized with branches entries and updated if subtrees are added or removed. If a change to the hierarchy occurs, all of the entries are reset to the current clock tick.
